intro: Corydalis pterygopetala subsp. pterygopetala, commonly known as the winged petal corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern China and northern Vietnam. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and clusters of small, delicate flowers. The flowers typically have two prominent, wing-like petals that give the plant its common name. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, kidney-shaped seeds. It is often grown in rock gardens or as a ground cover due to its ornamental value and hardy nature.
